Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD PLACE TO STAY IN AMSTERDAM”
Reviews.Author: highflyeye
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience staying here during jan 2012 . Room was spotless as was the toilet.Quiet location a short walk to tram and both 24 and 5 will get you into centre in around 15 minutes. Getting around Amsterdam and to and from the hotel was very easy. Only negative side would be the 7 euro for the all day pass that you need to get to the centre. Not worth buying tickets at each journey as the all day pass soon gets used up. We had very few issues with the staff who were always pleasant and helpful. We would have rated this hotel 5 but for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm, great staff, great neighborhood nice walk to the RAI”
Reviews.Author: johnnap
Reviews.Content: Have walked past this hotel for years. For years it was always full on my trips to A. Glad we kept trying, have booked for 2012

Reviews.Title: “pretty neighbourhood away from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: OllienPounce
Reviews.Content: A small hotel located in a pretty residential neighbourhood, just a short tram ride away from the central area, and within walking distance of the Rijksmuseum and van Gogh museum. A short tram ride the other direction takes you to Amsterdam Zoud station, which is one train station away from the airport, so you can avoid the busy Centraal station. The rooms are fine, really quiet, and the breakfast room is very nice with an assortment of hot and cold items. The desk staff were helpful if you had questions about transportation or directions somewhere. One problem for us was that with the wireless access (which is not free) you can only ever connect with one device, i.e. two iPods, a laptop/iPod combo are not permitted.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad service - Doesn't stand up to its 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: lacordaire
Reviews.Content: I stayed Appolo Hotel for one week (business trip) and won't return there anytime soon (and will recommend against this hotel for future business trips). Internet access was very poor (connections being interrupted all the time), breakfast ok but lunch not varied at all with a very rude service. Rooms are generally clean, but service was very mediocre from the start: had to wait for more than half an hour for my room to be ready. Even though I gave my credit cart to the waitress, the key to my room was later on inactivated without notice. Reason: they hadn't swaped my credit cart properly. What a joke knowing that we were business travellers and that our company was paying for all the expenses ... I was treated like a thief and of course do not appreciate that.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service”
Reviews.Author: PeterKNewYork
Reviews.Content: TV in my room did not work..i`ve asked the reception to fix it but no one came to see what was wrong with it..When i checked out the hotel they charged me for the TV anyway ,and there was NO way they admitted there own fault in this..very disappointing i will never go back here..

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a quiet location”
Reviews.Author: McGal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and it served our needs perfectly well. It is in a quieter location, and it is a bit out of the centre, but there are direct frequent trams to the centre. The staff were courteous and even though they could not find out booking they honoured it nonetheless as we had a print out from the company. There is a quiet bar and breakfast area and the rooms were nice. Overall, a nice place to stay, suitable more for a quiet stay rather than a mad one!

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable experience”
Reviews.Author: MaximillianAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in the Apollofirst hotel for three nights during Oktober 2006. Appolofirst is located in the best part of Amsterdam; Oud-Zuid. Not in the center but in a nice residence with wealthy locals and some tourists. The Appolofirst is housed in an authentic building which is typical for Amsterdam. The reception is small but cosy ,the staff is polite and do the best they can. The rooms are mediumsized and are decorated in a sort of authentic style. The rooms offer a average bed and a little place to sit. A workdesk is provided. The lightening was below average, not very special. The bathroom is large and clean and gives you a wealthy feeling. Unfortunately the rooms aren't very soundproof. In my opinion this hotel is very suitable for traveller's who like to stay in a quiet and very lovely area not far from Amsterdam's main hotspots where they can blend with the locals. Overall; a pretty nice place to stay, not very special but worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because in the previous reviews it got fairly good reports, my view of the hotel is not as good as the others but then again i only stayed for one night and i never had breakfast at the hotel. The receptionist on arrival was okay but not necessarily polite, i requested a no smoking room but the room i got had ash trays in it (so a smoking room i presume, although i couldn't smell any stale smoke), The hotel tries to give off a grand feel to the place but on closer inspection some of the decor looks a bit cheap, my room had a light that was only just attached to the ceiling with one screw, the radiators and piping in the bathroom had rust around the pipes an looked untidy and in one of the wardrobes on the floor was a clothes hook and screws that was missing from the back of the bathroom door. The bed in the room had sheets over it but the duvet was very thin and folded at the bottom of the bed so had to make the bed myself, okay these might be trivial matter's but it's the little things that let down this hotel when it looks promising in their website. On checking out, my bill was more than my booking confirmation, i questioned this and and showed the paperwork, i was told this was due to 5% tax, i worked out the 5% tax and it was still more than it should have been, when this was pointed out the receptionist did alter the bill to what it should have been. The location of the hotel is a good, good walk from the main tourist area near the station and main square but you are in a very quiet and nice looking area, the tram stop back to Amsterdam central station is literally a two minute walk away and the journey takes about 20 minutes. I would stay at this hotel again but only if i couldn't get into some of the more established (better) hotel's nearer the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly Staff, Hotel OK”
Reviews.Author: Neuenburg
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Applofirst from March 2-6th, 2005. It is a typical old Dutch hotel with some charm, though it could use some improvements (carpets are a bit shoddy and the rooms could use some brightening up). Its pluses are an extremely friendly and helpful staff - it is in a nice neighborhood walking distance to many places (Van Gogh Museum is 15 Minutes on foot, the university is about 20 minutes on foot). I found the price (125 Euros a night) a bit steep, however it does include breakfast (decent buffet style) and room tax. The breakfast room was lovely with windows to the back courtyard. You can have a nice beer in the evening in the "library" (fake books) and sit in a very comfy leather chair. Convenient shopping is near the hotel as well. Internet access is provided via access cards, which are 5 Euro per 30 Minutes, which works well. The bathrooms were spotlessly clean, which was a big plus, and the TV had German and English programs. And if you call the Shipholservice taxi company, they have a flat fee to the airport (22.50 Euro) - -------

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: PeepsPiper
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 20-22 August 2004. We had originally booked the Beethoven hotel around the corner, but upon arrival were advised that they had overbooked. They did us a favour by sending us to Apollofirst - it was a very nice, comfortable hotel - although it does not have all the facilities in the room that you'd expect with a four star rating - or for the price (115 Euros!). It is not right in the centre of Amsterdam but it is in a nice area. The tram stops at the end of the street and it takes about 10 minutes to Dam and 20 minutes to get to the central station. The trams are really frequent, so this was no problem. The included breakfast was a highlight as it included a cooked breakfast and not just pretend-toast or a bread roll and jam! It was also served until 10.30am, which is a definite bonus when you are on holiday. The staff were really friendly, and we enjoyed the stay - once we got over the fact that we were paying double what we have paid for comparable Western European hotels in our travels! But it seems that was the curse of booking a last minute weekend in Amsterdam - and we have no regrets.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not terrific either...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location is not bad, the tram station is near from the hotel, not too much traffic passing by, there's a supermarkt nearby, some restaurants, and the surroundings look actually quite nice. It would be suitable for people who would prefer staying in a more peaceful part of Amsterdam. The room is fine, the staffs are friendly too. But I would advice people not to expect a quality of a 4-star hotel (which they claim to be); this hotel would rather do as an 'above average' 3-star hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Apollofirst - Hampshire Classic
HotelInfo.Address: Apollolaan 123, Amsterdam 1077 AP, The Netherlands
